perturbation.original_text:
26. Arbitration of Disputes. The parties agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to settle amicably any controversy, or claim arising out
of the Agreement or any breach thereof through a dispute resolution process involving Wade and members from the senior management of Naked.
If the parties do not otherwise agree, either party may present any unresolved dispute for arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration
Rules of the American Arbitration Association (the “Rules”) then in effect. Such arbitration will be held in New York, NY. The arbitration will be by a
single arbitrator chosen by the parties, provided that if the parties fail to agree and to appoint a single arbitrator within twenty (20) business days
from the date that one of the parties has made a demand for  arbitration, then the arbitrator will be chosen in accordance with the Rules.  The
decision of the arbitrator will be final and binding on the parties and any  award of the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent
jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text:
26. Arbitration of Disputes. The parties agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to settle amicably any controversy, or claim arising out
of the Agreement or any breach thereof through a dispute resolution process involving Wade and members from the senior management of Naked.
If the parties do not otherwise agree, either party may present any unresolved dispute for arbitration, but shall not be in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (the “Rules”) then in effect. The arbitration will be held in a location selected by Naked. The arbitration will be by a single arbitrator chosen by Naked, provided that if the parties fail to agree and to appoint a single arbitrator within twenty (20) business days from the date that one of the parties has made a demand for  arbitration, then the arbitrator will be someone known to Naked. The
decision of the arbitrator will not be final and binding on the parties, and either party may seek legal remedies in a court of law.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the arbitration clause, the enforceability of the original clause is reduced. Originally, there was a neutral method of choosing an arbitrator. This is removed and the selection is given only to Naked, making it biased. Also, the 'final and binding' clause is removed, which means the outcome of the arbitration may be challenged in court.

perturbation.original_text:
25. Choice of Law. This Agreement, all amendments hereto, and any and all issues or controversies arising here from or related hereto, shall
be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the laws of the State of New York.
perturbation.changed_text:
25. Choice of Law. This Agreement, all amendments hereto, and any and all issues or controversies arising here from or related hereto, shall
be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the laws of the State of Alaska.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the choice of law to Alaska when the company is based in Delaware and the agreement is signed in New York introduces uncertainty and potential challenges to the interpretation and enforcement of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law Principles

perturbation.original_text:
31. No Third Party  Beneficiaries. This Agreement is not for the benefit of any third party and  shall be deemed not to give any right or
remedy to such third party, whether referred to herein or not.
perturbation.changed_text: 31. No Third Party  Beneficiaries. This Agreement is not for the benefit of any third party unless Wade decides, and  shall be deemed to give rights to those parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by first stating there are no third-party beneficiaries, and then adding a clause that allows Wade to designate third-party beneficiaries. This can cause confusion and make the clause difficult to enforce.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Third Party Beneficiary Principles
